website_summaries.verdict: Extremely easy to use while giving you a variety of measurements of your soil situation.
pros: Doesn't require battery to operate, making it very easy to use
Also helps you figure out if indoor plants are getting enough light
Measures soil moisture and pH, helping you add correct nutrients to the soil
cons: Might be too simplistic for some gardeners

customer_reviews.title: Nice meter.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little meter. I don't use the light meter part, but moisture meter is accurate enough to let me know when plants need water, without me having to pick up the pots and guess if they do or not. Ph meter gives me a rough range of where the soil ph is at, and I've tested it against the soil test kit I have. It gives me a piece of mind without having to pull samples for testing. Great investment, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L.

customer_reviews.title: You might as well go with Fisher Price.
customer_reviews.text: This product is a sham. The pH meter is simply non-functional. I tested it in the lawn, a bowl of lemon water and a ripe tomato and the pH never once budged from 7. I should have known it was too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: C C.

customer_reviews.title: Great item..
customer_reviews.text: I love this meter... it solves a lot of Gardening Questions in one appliance!! It works great and my plants will be all the happier for it!! Keeps me from over-watering when plants "look" dry.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie A French

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work
customer_reviews.text: This was very simple to use. Just move the switch to either moisture, light, or pH depending upon what you wish to measure. Then put it in the ground and wait. It appears to be accurate. The ground in which I have some pink hydrangea vs blue hydrangea registered what I would expect. Now I can check the areas where I am unsure. It also helped me determine if there was excessive moisture around some new shrubs I planted. I had several die last year because too much water was pooling around the root ball, I tried to improve drainage and replaced the shrubs. Luckily they seem to be dry enough this year despite the excess rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It DOES EXACTLY WHAT I WANT!
customer_reviews.text: Look, for the cost and ease of use its a great product, the only very small whine complaint, is I wish i could look DOWN while standing up and read the unit instead of walking away to read it..... again other than that stepping 2 feet in front i can see it clearly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for garden enthusiast
customer_reviews.text: This helps me with my garden. Now I know if I need to water my vegetables or not. The nice th8nag about it is that it can also measure the ph of my soil as well as the strength of the light my plants are getting in a particular spot. No more guessing for me. Highly recommended if you are into gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Small Castle

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Prongs are too long to read typical lawns. You push it into the ground and hit a rock and the prong bends. Mine bent and broke on the fifth push. Prongs are about nine inches long. Typical Grass Roots are five inches at the most. The seller admitted to me that there is a problem with the prongs breaking or bending and recommended I make a hole first then put the prongs in the hole I made. Stupid idea. Why not just make the prongs twice as sturdy and charge a little more. People are buying the product because it's cheap. And it is!!!
customer_reviews.author: driving

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Living in the woods and having red clay for the dirt, this is great to help me with my gardens. It is easy to use and read. I have used this in both pots and just the ground. I was shocked that I was off as much as I was to where things need to be. I moved plants over a week ago to a location that they seem to like much better. This is a very handy tool to have whether you have plants in pots or in the garden. Helps to better treat the soil so the PH is what the plants need. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jmbilletTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Clever design
customer_reviews.text: Simple design but works reliably. Zinc-copper cell battery + galvanometer + solar cell, triple in one. solar cell measures light intensity. Zinc-copper battery measures PH, and provides power for moisture meter. It's easy to find a moisture meter, but its hard to find such delicate design combine three in one.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: easy to check pH and water
customer_reviews.text: works as expected and indicated. easy to check pH and water.
customer_reviews.author: Phargot

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Time or Money
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews, especially those that were negative. I read theinstructions and inserterd the probes into the soils to the correct depth. No matter where I placed them in my lawn (which is known to be acidic, especially under a large oak tree), the PH meter never changed from a completely neutral (7.0) reading. This is a worthless piece of junk that absolutely will not read accurate soil PH levels. If you want an accurate PH reading DO NOT purchase this junk. You WILL be disappointed, as I was.
customer_reviews.author: Last Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Do a Single Job Well, Please
customer_reviews.text: Knowing soil pH IS important. You can't figure it out without a meter. So what do they do? They add stupid stuff. I don't need a moisture meter, I have a finger. Ditto for eyes and a light meter. What I WOULD like is sturdier prongs (these collapse on hitting an obstacle), and something EASY to read. The pH scale is in teeny, tiny, print at the bottom. Shaking my head ...
customer_reviews.author: Dixie Reader

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a green thumb. I just plant things and expect them to grow....which was not working out. After some research I learned to have a successful garden soil PH is important. Well as you can see it worked:-)
customer_reviews.author: C.J.

customer_reviews.title: Readings were not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Readings compared to the results we received by sending soil to the Soillab at Rutgers university were not anywhere near correct.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald O.

customer_reviews.title: Generous Company!
customer_reviews.text: Update: When I first bought the item didn’t work but the company gave me a full refund. They’re working with a new manufacturer and working to get better products made.
customer_reviews.author: Lemonkiss

customer_reviews.title: Good Gauge
customer_reviews.text: This gauge is very easy to use. I bought it to use in an elevated garden box that I’m using to grow tomatoes. I tested the soil after I had put everything in it that the nursery owner said it needed. The pH level showed up as 7.0. Tomatoes need 6.5 so I started amending the soil with peat and manure. It didn’t change the pH so I’ll just give it time and see how my tomatoes do. The light meter definitely works! As I would move my hand in front of it, it kept changing the amount of light. I love the ease of use and will continue to use it. Time will tell about the pH.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaSue

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 2, neither work.
customer_reviews.text: Both items are supposed to measure light. I can shine a tactical grade flashlight, put it under a plant light, or place the meters outside in full sunlight, and neither registers any light. Yes, I had them switched to "light". They both deliver very different readings regarding how moist soil is, even when placed as close to one another as possible. Additionally, the prongs bend very easily, no matter how gentle you are. A waste of money. Twice.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Darling

customer_reviews.title: Not a great indoor light meter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the moisture and light meter for my indoor plants. Moisture reads fine, but does not work well for indoors. It detects natural sunlight outdoors if I stick it out the balcony, but not from inside my northwest facing sliding door/window. Anywhere in my room reads zero. So now I mainly use this for moisture detection. Instructions on how to use is straightforward, and moisture scale of 1-10 makes sense, but the light meter scale of 0-2000 doesn't make sense at all, 2000 what?
customer_reviews.author: Arathena

customer_reviews.title: Very well made, sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: New at using this type of equipment so don’t know all it’s accuracies. The moisture meter is right on accurate I know. Very well made meter, sturdy. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Peice of Junk/Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Measures well, problem is the probes don't last very long. After testing for two days, one of the legs of the probes bent and eventually snapped off as I tried to straigten the legs out again. Waste of money. Update: So the company saw my review and immediately offered to send me a replacement. I will say that is pretty amazing customer service. So if nothing else, this is truly satisfaction guranteed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kim

customer_reviews.title: complete junk
customer_reviews.text: I placed the meter, as directed, about 2/3 of the way into moist soil. After some time it still read "dry". Repeated tests in different soil, some very wet, still read "dry". Don't waste your money, my common sense told me an accurate testing device could not sell this cheaply, and guess what? I was right, and was foolish to buy in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: bonedocTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Great garden tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to ensure that my garden was getting the nutrients it needed. It is easy to use and figure out, there are different modes you put the took into for pH, moisture and light. The display is a little small and hard to see for some people but I can still read it. It goes in the soil just fine and was pretty easy to clean it off between uses. It seems pretty durable and has survived my son testing the soil.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Handy tool to have to check flower garden soil.
customer_reviews.author: The Bagman

customer_reviews.title: I need more instructions.
customer_reviews.text: I find the meter did work but it was hard to read. You have to get down to ground level and try to read it. When you try to take it out it goes back to zero. You can't put it in dry ground. So of course you water. Then what is the moisture dile for? I don't know what the light heater is for because the light keeps moving in the yard. I think I need more instructions. My it is good for house plants.
customer_reviews.author: Melody T.

customer_reviews.title: Mine did not work
customer_reviews.text: I followed instructions tested it out in 4 different house plants that i knew had different levels of moisture and none of them worked, for any of the 3 options. Instructions says no batteries required but there is a solar panel for the light so I even tried to charge that in the sun to see if that part worked and it did not. The solar panel to detect the light was off center and I'm sure that's why that part does not work. Very disappointed. When 0 out of the 3 component does not work I really don't think I'll take a chance on buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: ali tippytapper

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this to keep tabs on my moisture and lighting and not having to reach into each pot to check moisture. It worked great on the first day checking the moisture level of my plants. After a couple uses, it says everything is dry even after watering. Unfortunately, the light measure never worked. I placed it by my plants in a west-facing window in the late afternoon (with bright Florida sun) and the needle barely moved saying it was still dark. Definitely not a dark area, where typical plants will sunburn. So I guess it's back to finger testing...
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: To broad a spectrum for an useful reading...  Small meter is hard to read...
customer_reviews.text: I do backyard gardening and worm composting. Still, when I want a Ph reading; I want it to be within 1/10th. This meter give you an idea that your Ph is somewhere around 6 or maybe 7. I want to know that it is 6.8 or 7.2. For plants and worms, knowing the Ph is important to understanding how well what your planting will grow. And, if necessary, fixing the soil. The moisture reading is perhaps a bit better. And, the sunlight is OK. I will send this one back and look for something a bit better even though I know it will cost more.
customer_reviews.author: Scrub Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: I find that this does not work. I always have about the same reading no matter where I put it in the planter which is somewhere around seven. I have even made efforts to adjust the pH of my soil by lowering the pH of the water and feed I put in and it still does not move the needle. It’s either broken or a cheap product
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent readings, bent after a week.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to check the moisture level of some potted plants on the porch. I followed instructions and got very different back to back readings in the same spot, then one of the prongs eventually bent outward. We finally threw it away and just decided to make a game out of this and take bets on how long it takes to kill our plants.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Christine

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and accurate, too.
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a device to easily measure the pH in my soil in order to improve my lawn. When I saw the reviews for the Atree Meter, it was an easy choice. The meter accurately measured the soil pH, as compared to a chemical analysis kit, and so much easier. The moisture and light measurements are an added bonus in my case, and now my wife uses the meter in her flower gardens to check moisture levels. Highly recommended for lawn and garden use.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: 1st one did not work
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product and it was an uber fail. moisture meter registered moist not wet when submerged in water. Light meter registered dark when held directly to light source. I have returned and ordered another because of course there are some lemons in every batch. will give update with new device.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Growe

customer_reviews.title: For reading moisture, it works great, very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I only bought it to use to read moisture content and I was pleasantly surprised to see this thing actually works! Maybe that’s because it’s two pronged, I don’t know. I can’t speak for the PH and whatever the light part is supposed to measure, but for what I need, to check moisture level in pots, it’s perfect. Don’t soak it in water to clean it and don’t break it trying to shove it through hard ground and it should hold up well. We just wipe the rods off with a dry paper towel.
customer_reviews.author: SNBow

customer_reviews.title: Helps Me Not Overwater, Not Under-light, and Accurately Adjust the PH
customer_reviews.text: I've used the water meter to double-check my own testing testing method--sticking my finger in the soil. Turns out my finger test is not very accurate. I've been over-watering, so this meter has caused me to cut back on the watering. I've used the light meter in an area that is under a shade cloth. I've confirmed that the shade cloth is letting plenty of this intense Texas sun through. I plan to use the Ph probe on some container plants. Our soils are notoriously alkaline and I'll be attempting to make them more acidic. I'll be using PH Down a little at a time and this meter will tell me when to stop.
customer_reviews.author: BigDLittleT

customer_reviews.title: Item defective, doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited for this to arrive, as I’ve had some inconsistencies in which plants dry out and which ones don’t need to be watered for weeks. Unfortunately, it doesn’t work. I put it in the soil of a plant I watered yesterday and it said “Dry.” I watered a plant and put the probe in and it said “Dry.” It seems the needle on the gauge moves on its own, and is fairly loose. This won’t work for anyone who has plants in soil that don’t need to be drowned in water (aka any plant at all...)
customer_reviews.author: Funshyne328

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I guess it worked for few days but then I noticed there's something wrong with it, like it was reporting a soil as dry while obviously it was moist and I even digged deep just to make sure! The PH meter is not accurate as well. It was showing the soil as alkalin while this was a soil with acidifiers regularly added to it. A gain just to make sure, I measured with another two other methods. And yes I was giving it 10 mins to work and still it didnt work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Sara.r

customer_reviews.title: Ok for plant beginners or perfect lighting in the makers eyes
customer_reviews.text: Ok so everything was ok, except the light meter. It would be much more accurate if the meter eye and reader were on top, as not everyone has the ability to measure from the correct angle for reading results. If your light source and you are not parallel, you can’t read the window.
customer_reviews.author: James and Becky E.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but difficult to read
customer_reviews.text: The dial is very small. There is no hold button so once you insert the probes you have to be on your hands and knees with to see the reading. The pH is especially difficult to assess. Good thing is you merely slide a switch to select the function even if you can't see it well. I can't speak to it's accuracy as I have noting to check it against but all the readings seem to be reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Duri

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this product for measuring ph in a lawn. The scale is from 8 (alkaline) through 5.5 (acidic). A ph of 7 is neutral. The color scale makes no sense. The far left green marker is over 8; although it should be over 7. The neutral position of the indicator needle is 8. It should be 7. The orientation of the device is vertical. When using on a lawn, it is necessary to get one's face on the ground to read the scale. Although the scale design is bad, the device may be easier to use in a pot at eye level.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: PH Meter was way off
customer_reviews.text: I ended up killing my plants as this meter was reading way too alkaline. It varied with different soils, but never showed much below a PH of 7. the truth was, with the acidifier I put in, because f this reading, my plants died. I bought two additional PH kits from different companies, and both of them read reatively the same... way too acidic. i also tested the kits with known PH water and they ere accurate. This device WAS NOT Accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Ralt584489

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but...
customer_reviews.text: ...it's too difficult to read. For me, at least. And it seems to me that the size of the window for readings could be expanded simply by reducing or eliminating the "Three-Way Meter" plaque. After all, the packaging is clear on what the product is and generally people don't need to reminded of what they bought. Other than that, the moisture gauge works well, helping me keep my indoor plants healthy in this bone-dry apartment.
customer_reviews.author: hawk-of-the-field

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Been using it to monitor the soil for feeding time check the plants today and still on moist by the time I get home it should be close to dry then I water them again ph meter seems to be on point as the plants look really healthy hopefully another thing I love it's the light meter helps me make sure every plant is getting the same amount of light great tool for beginner gardeners.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Any Plant Lover of All Skill Levels
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guy off a recommendation from youtube. Little did I know how much I truly needed it. I have a bad habit of overwatering my plants because I just want to see them grow and flourish. This little gadget really helps me not overwater and kill my plants. Just make sure you take multiple measurements in the pot to get the most accurate reading. Overall I highly recommend this product for plant lovers of all skill levels including expert!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Perfect moisture meter for my fiddle leaf fig tree
customer_reviews.text: I recently took up gardening as one of my quarantine hobbies and purchase a fiddle leaf fig tree. It was doing fine, then started slowly dying and I couldn't understand why because the soil felt dry to touch whenever I watered it. I purchased this meter to get a read on the moisture level deeper within the soil and it has helped bring my tree back to life! Such a critical tool I 100% recommend it
customer_reviews.author: JulieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: pH Readings Are Not Accurate
customer_reviews.text: As it has been the mistake of other buyers of this product, I should have read the reviews about the pH function. The moisture and light functions seem fine, but the pH reading never goes below 7.0 regardless of what kind of soil I put the meter in, however deep I plunge the probes, and however long I leave it in the soil. I tested this on potting soil mixed with sulphur, and no matter what, the needle read neutral to alkaline.
customer_reviews.author: H. Quan

customer_reviews.title: A useful tool for an inexpensive price
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Northeast and this is a very versatile tool and very helpful to assist managing soil for various planting and growth purposes. Also very inexpensive. The light meter doesn't need much light before maxing out which I guess is OK. I use the PH meter the most and this was helpful in identifying over-alkaline soil that was yellowing my tomato leaves. Not needing batteries is another plus. I recommend this as well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: TheS___'s

customer_reviews.title: Moisture, PH and Sun Meter
customer_reviews.text: Shipment of the meter was surprisily fast. Opened the box and stuck the meter into my planter and it instantly read the moisture and ph levels of my raised garden. Top of soil looked dry but inserted the meter probes approximately 2-4" deep and the meter read that the soil was moist. If the meter is accurate, it will help solve watering guessing game. Thinking of buying another unit for meter comparison and the convience of having another.
customer_reviews.author: Fu

customer_reviews.title: Got a magnifying glass?
customer_reviews.text: Decent meter at a great price. Although the moisture reading is apparent, you'd need a magnifying glass to get a read on the ph down there at the bottom. Seriously. Unless your eyesight is great, this won't do. The ph was accurate checked with a base 7.0 test. Note that you're not supposed to use it in liquids. (I did, no apparent harm, but too bad it doesn't do this.)
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Abel

customer_reviews.title: Moisture reading is completely inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Moisture reading never goes beyond the beginning of the green mark even though I have tested in several mediums including one that had water draining from it. I feel that because of this error I most likely ruined my seed plantings by overwatering.
customer_reviews.author: Copterits

customer_reviews.title: Try something else.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair for our two vegetable garden beds. One, nothing works. The other, the light meter works. The moisture meter may work. The Ph meter, that's difficult to tell. We did a homemade test of the Ph (vinegar and baking Soda tests) and our soil appears fairly neutral. But the meter never moved at all. It might be accurate. Overall, I would use this for the light measure and maybe the moisture (but it seems to want something soaking to read as moist). Plus, one didn't work at all. Not really worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: pH readings stuck on 7 - avoid
customer_reviews.text: I think the idea of this meter is great and 2 out of 3 functions seem to perform wonderfully. However, the pH meter is the reason I bought this item. The pH meter would not budge off of 7 no matter what I soil I was reading (garden soil in raised bed (non-native soil) and my yard). In addition, the green plastic housing was marked up like it had been used before. Save your money and go buy a more expensive and quality unit or take soil samples and send them to your state ag lab or a private lab. You'll be much happier with the results.
customer_reviews.author: EZ

customer_reviews.title: Not set to starting point
customer_reviews.text: This meter is not set to zero point. Whatever reading I see with is not sure about accuracy Updates: Customer service team reached out immediately with my concerns, they are very helpful in addressing my issues they helped with all of queries...
customer_reviews.author: Satish

customer_reviews.title: Nice soil moisture meter
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity of this device, which was recommended in an article featuring landscaping. The only thing that I found a bit awkward is that when placed into the soil vertically and fairly deep it is hard to read the meter. The best way I found was to angle it into the soil to make reading it easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No need for batteries, works well.
customer_reviews.text: This does everything it claims to do. Good for checking all the plants without getting dirty fingers from poking soil.
customer_reviews.author: B Payne

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate and easy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried other water meters on my plants. The kind that pop up when they get dry, and those just don’t work at all. This works perfect this works perfect on all my plants. Very easy to use. And it helped me identify and overwatering situation on my fiddle leaf fig. I even bought one to send to my son.
customer_reviews.author: Brewhill

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This came in very hand to check my soil levels for my Jane Magnolia. The leaves were yellowing and we were not sure what was wrong. By using this meter and checking the levels we discovered our PH was off. We were able to correct the problem and this tool will come in handy for other plants in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Kat S

customer_reviews.title: Neat little tool that packs a punch
customer_reviews.text: This soil testing probe has been perfect for me to get my new quarantine garden going. Honestly, I didn’t think it would work as well as it does because I have spent significant amounts of time testing the ph on my soil with drops. This little probe has been pleasantly surprising. Sometimes I think my plants are looking parched, and it tells me the moisture levels are fine. Learning to trust this little device has given me so much botanical joy. I also love the fact that it's always ready to go - no batteries required.
customer_reviews.author: yshaf13

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't measure wetness accurately
customer_reviews.text: I thoroughly watered some of my plants and then received the meter in the mail an hour later. I was so excited! I decided to go ahead and measure my pots while I knew they were wet to start understanding how to use the meter. Well, unfortunately the meter decided my pots (which in actuality were very moist, being as I had just watered them) were very dry. I checked a few different pots with different types of soil and unfortunately it just didn't do great. Also, probably since it was two pronged, it was very difficult to get into the soil without damaging my plant's root system. Sadly I'll have to look for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Haley Hetrick

customer_reviews.title: Not for PH testing
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to be accurate regarding moisture and sunlight, However, after returning the first one because it did not measure PH (the reason I ordered it) the second one did not either. Needle does not move no matter what the medium is-garden soil-leaf mold or sand. I am not going to bother to return it because of the Covid 19 restrictions but would not recommend it for reading soil acidity.
customer_reviews.author: Bev Creighton

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate enough to trust
customer_reviews.text: The meter never reaches the dryest setting when testing for moisture. It sits on the 2 ("dry") and stays there even when testing moist soil. The only time the gauge changed was when I poured a ton of water on some dirt and immediately stuck in the nodes. I'm not sure what to think of this thing. I'm not very trusting of the readings.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Just doesn’t seem to give the right moisture readings, I’ve down it right after pouring a half gallon water in my pots and I barely get a moist reading and that’s what I wanted it for, lost my tomato 🍅 plant due to root rot and don’t want that again 😢 I don’t have a lot of plants I live in apartment and have indoor and porch stuff I’ll roll my tomato 🍅 plant out in the sun with my pepper but lost my tomato so bought this and doesn’t really work
customer_reviews.author: Bill Ballman

customer_reviews.title: print or size of meter is very small, hard to read
customer_reviews.text: It seems to do the job, however, I found it very difficult to read the small print on the gauge, for someone who can bend over easily or does not have a vision correction, probably Ok, but I would not reccommend it for someone that has both like myself, is fine for potted plants where you can test at eye level.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: subpar at best
customer_reviews.text: The moisture option seems to be working fine but the pH and light options don't move at all. I've tried 5 different levels of light and it never moved and I tried 3 different plants to test out the pH and again, dial never moves. It will most likely be going back tomorrow. What's the point keeping something is only 1/3 works??!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Humber

customer_reviews.title: ph scale too compressed to measure differences
customer_reviews.text: The scale displayed for pH is too compressed to measure slight differences in soil basically you are just determining if your soil is basic or acidic. Be better if scale was modified so small differences could by detected but since ph is log of a power 10 I guess that makes it difficult to make a gauge,
customer_reviews.author: Frank E.

customer_reviews.title: The aluminum measuring rod is easy to bend or break
customer_reviews.text: Does a lot for the money but the two parallel rods are tricky to insert in soil without bending the softer of the two rods. One rod is made of aluminum and is very easy to bend and break even in soft soils. The aluminum rod bent the first time I inserted the tester probe into soft potting soil. I straightened it out and It quickly bent again. The second rod is made of steal and is considerably stiffer and harder. Be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas

customer_reviews.title: meh - moisture reading feels completely inaccurte
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for one of my garden pots. The light meter and Ph work find - double checked the Ph with a soil test kit just before inserting the meter. The moisture reading - ah no. Freshly watered - saturated in fact and reads dry - so if that's what you're looking for - keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: RustyNails

customer_reviews.title: Easy way for soil check and no battery required
customer_reviews.text: * Best thing no battery required for this. * I am using this for my flower pots to make sure I not over water them. Flowers and succulent indoor need a care for over watering. * Not sure how long battery will stay as we can not replace that.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to read, not useful!
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised by all the great reviews. I don't know how anybody can read this thing! Maybe in a container at eye-level, but certainly not in the ground. It should pivot to face upward or be able to lock readings in place when you pull it out of the ground. I am returning it!
customer_reviews.author: earthborne

customer_reviews.title: ph testing is totally useless
customer_reviews.text: I grow rare tropical fruit in containers, I grow most in a mixture of peat, coconut coir, which should be acid. Every single potted plant I tested, had the same ph, 7.5, so I dipped it in pure vinegar, which has a ph of 2, it showed a ph of 6. This is pretty much totally useless. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: dbguru

customer_reviews.title: Cheap as hell
customer_reviews.text: It's not as if this is completely inaccurate, my big problem is that this thing broke in less than two months of use. I would insert this in loose potting soil and when I would pull it out, the rods were bent out of shape. I'M NOT HARDLY USING ANY FORCE TO INSERT OR TAKE OUT. As of 3 days ago, one of the rods just completely broke and is hanging by a wire. What kind of cheap piece of garbage is this?
customer_reviews.author: Richard W

customer_reviews.title: worthy every penny
customer_reviews.text: I saw someone using this on their plants on YouTube and had to get one. It works great. Tried it on all my plants and it is accurate for moisture level and sunlight. Didn't try the PH part as I have no idea what my soil levels are for the houseplants I have. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dotoriffic

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 45 days;1 to 3 stars for seller response
customer_reviews.text: I only used it to measure moisture, not pH or light, and it appeared to be measuring moisture since the reading changed after watering, over time, and from plant to plant. However, now (45 days after purchase), it reads between 1-2 on the moisture at all times and in all plants. Since it broke so soon, I now have my doubts about the moisture measurements it gave me during its brief life. 10-Dec-19:updating from * to *** b/c seller offered and completed a refund before I requested it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Fishburn

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I have one without the light sensor for outside and got this one for use in the house. It works good and reads close to the outdoor one. The light sensor is a good addition for placing different plants around you house in correct locations.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Used Unit
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine for my succulents, which is why I purchased it. But I am pretty sure mine came used, as the head (especially the back) was all scuffed when I took it out of the package. It is a good starting point for me, so I guess a used unit isn't the end of the world.
customer_reviews.author: Denae Henderson

customer_reviews.title: meter broke within first 2 wks
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to use this, but one of the two prongs snapped off after my 5th time using it. Also, when I inserted it into the mulch around my rose bush, in one section it would say it was completely moist and in another section of the same plant (maybe only 3-4 inchs away from the first) it was say it was compeltely dry.
customer_reviews.author: Nadalee Demaree

customer_reviews.title: This product never worked.
customer_reviews.text: "Simply insert the probes into the soil". One could easily replace this piece of guidance with "Simply insert the probes into trashcan and buy something else". The needle in this device has never moved, and may well be painted on for all I know. Switching between functions was as pointless as this purchase. On no setting did this device react in any way, shape or form to its environment.
customer_reviews.author: Myles McManus

customer_reviews.title: Ph meter is worthless
customer_reviews.text: The ph meter is perfectly worthless. Milk, coffee grounds, a tomato, potting soil, peat moss, an apple, and water all register the exact same ph measurement. (Moisture and light meters might work, but I have fingers and eyes, so I had only bought it for the ph meter).
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Too much water?  Too little water? Now I Know.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this to test the soil for wetness. It paid for itself the first day. It was amazing to find whether I was under watering or over-watering my indoor plants. I've always struggled with that decision on my outdoor plants to. Looking forward to getting out there this spring.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: The Probes, especially the 'alluminum?' side, bend easily - careful
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this meter a few days over a year ago - July 2019. Used primarily for moisture and very helpful - accurate, I think. However, USER BEWARE! THE PROBES BEND EASILY AND WILL EVENTUALLY BREAK! Mine broke recently - the 'aluminum?' side - where it enters the meter after a year of use (abuse?). I will order another one but will be much more careful with the probes. No other complaints - appears to be a good item. By the way, there is a wire inside the probe attached to the tip. The meter still works, just very awkward. Fairly easy to read but better if the display was angled in a more upward direction.
customer_reviews.author: SWLS

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Said everything was wet, even when put in dry material. Not a very good thing to spend money on. I do not recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Jeb

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if your checking ph levels of your soil
customer_reviews.text: If your looking to test the ph of your soil don’t use this you will get the wrong results . Your better off sending your soil to a lab . They not only gave my ph but also recommended products to fix it , and broke down all the current nutrient levels in my soil .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved my Alocasia
customer_reviews.text: This product helped me realize I was severely under watering my alocasias. Now he's finally putting out new growth. I have 20+ houseplants so this product is extremely helpful. I haven't used the pH option, but the light option was an eye opener as well. I would highly recommend this for newbies and seasoned green thumbs alike.
customer_reviews.author: Abby G.

customer_reviews.title: Try it! Customer Service is wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: As a novice gardener with a tendency to over-water, a desire to try new plants, and an insatiable curiosity, I found great comfort in the three readings, moisture, ph, and light found on the A-Tree, to help me navigate through this gardening experience. I’ve altered my ph successfully, no longer have soggy hanging baskets and feel more confident trying new plants.
customer_reviews.author: Goia

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I found it extremely accurate in letting me know the water needs of my houseplants and my outside plants. From the sucklents all the way to my garden needs..This is easy to read and list on the back of the packaging regarding the water requirements of individual plants was very helpful. Made of sturdy strong materials. This was not flimsy in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Shane steck

customer_reviews.title: So helpful for growing Veggies in the home.
customer_reviews.text: For a long time, I was concerned about if I was giving the veggies to much water or not enough water. I didn't know this existed. But my daughter has two of them and when I got this. YEAH! Yes, I now know what to water and what not to water.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Does not work very well
customer_reviews.text: The moisture measurement works well. The pH is questionable and requires wet soil and the probes to be inserted very deep, then the meter fluctuates with exactly how deep it is inserted. The light measurement seems accurate enough.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L

customer_reviews.title: Convenient to monitor garden moisture
customer_reviews.text: The meter is really convenient to monitor my soil. I have a few trees in large containers and want to make sure my drip system is watering different areas around the trees when it gets too dry. I easily check within seconds. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Tom Phan

customer_reviews.title: Overalll I guess??  an ok meter.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I could check more than just the moisture of my plants, verses other meters. I feel the meter is a bit off. I have two of them both different and I’m getting completely didn’t levels. Both are relatively in the same spot. I can say I did drop it a couple times today. Oops... But not so sure if that contributed to the problem.
customer_reviews.author: R3

customer_reviews.title: Simple design  unsure of accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work ok. Not sure about the ph level. I tested it in multiple areas and the readings were basically the same, lawn, plants & evergreens. I think it should of showed a more acidic level in certain areas. It would probably be helpful for the sake of this review to compare it with ph level kit. The meter was kind of hard to read for me due to aging eyes. Maybe a digital readout would be better for me.
customer_reviews.author: weldon

customer_reviews.title: Great product to help your garden grow
customer_reviews.text: Product helps 2 determine what is happening under the ground by where the roots are. The surface of the ground may be totally dry but totally wet by The Roots. This product helps to check the wetness word count and also the pH for Optimum growing
customer_reviews.author: kmjen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in device. Seller was good about correcting problem.
customer_reviews.text: did not work out of box. hard to see pH readings. light meter showed dark directly under grow light. very disappointed. UPDATE: After confirming the device was defective out of the box, the shipper/mfg provided a refund quickly. I am pleased with the response to the defective item. MIGHT try them again for a different item.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: water meter
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Tells wife when and when not to water. Over water is a problem
customer_reviews.author: fish789

customer_reviews.title: May not be meant for outside use.
customer_reviews.text: It rained while I had it in the flower garden and now there is so much moister in the meter that it can’t be read. Vendor is going to replace it. Other then the problem with moisture I love it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Navarre

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Liked it so much I bought another. Invaluable for calculating pH and soil moisture since it's not always evident when watering is needed. If you spend a good deal of time and money in the garden, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JcX1111

customer_reviews.title: Accurate?
customer_reviews.text: Is this tested? No matter where I place the meter, I get identical readings. I amended the soil using aluminum sulfate in order to plant moss. I got the same reading after amending the soil as before. Either the meter or the aluminum sulfate we had just gotten from our local garden shop does not work. I may not be fair here, but maybe a 3 in 1 tries to accomplish too much.
customer_reviews.author: - MJ

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool to check PH and wetness of the soil.
customer_reviews.text: I use it in my flower and vegetable garden area. I seems accurate and the products I have used to change the PH of my soil seems to work based on the readings. I do notice that accuracy may be better if you wipe of the probes after each probe.
customer_reviews.author: Julia M. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Worked great! Broke within a week.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great but bent after first day (no I didn't hit a rock). One side broke off within a week and I still kept using it holding it in my hand until today, when the wire broke. PH tested like my soil sample which was good. I loved it to check on my lawn moisture. Am I overwatering? Underwatering? I wish they would send me a new one, but my window for return was up. I should have sent it back when it bent. :( Also, I could not read the meter when it was in the ground. I had to take a pic of it to see what it said. BUT, I still loved it! :)
customer_reviews.author: Boobabla

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use moisture ,light,and ph meter
customer_reviews.text: Works good at light measurements and soil moisture checking . The ph varies with amount of moisture in soil but usually gives a result close to the ph . Doesn’t need batteries which is nice and is easy to use as well
customer_reviews.author: select few

customer_reviews.title: Works well for novice gardeners.
customer_reviews.text: This product is so simple to use that at first I wondered if it was working. I got it to test soil alkalinity for blueberries and it does a very nice job. I am sure there are more sophisticated and perhaps more accurate tools on the market but for a simple gardener growing plants just for himself this tool does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cope

customer_reviews.title: Product seems to be a great product
customer_reviews.text: Product is fine but only has houseplants and I got it for herbs, veggies and fruits. I need to find a good resource with that info and am sure this product will work great when I find a resource.
customer_reviews.author: Debra P.

customer_reviews.title: Great company
customer_reviews.text: My item came to me non-functional but the company quickly made it right, sad that I got a defective product but at least the company is on top of it!
customer_reviews.author: Lucienne

product_meta.title: Atree Soil pH Meter, 3-in-1 Soil Tester Kits with Moisture,Light and PH Test for Garden, Farm, Lawn, Indoor & Outdoor (No Battery Needed)
feature_bullets: 3-IN-1 FUNCTIONS: You can measure soil moisture, pH value and sunlight intensity. It's helpful for you to plant flowers, plants and make them grow healthy and strong(This soil tester CAN ONLY be used in soil, it CANNOT be used to test any liquids)
EASY TO USE: Simply insert the probes into the soil about 4-6 inches (2/3 of the probes), and you'll get your reading
COMPACT FOR INDOOR & OUTDOOR USE: Know when to water, adjust pH, or change lighting for your flowers, plants both indoor and outdoor
NO BATTERY NEEDED: No batteries or electricity needed, plug and read
SCIENTIFICALLY ACCURATE: Sensitive probe could sense changes of the soil and transfer details to the conductor, displaying the accurate values for you

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,795 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
